tool_description: Faking simple objects and lists with java faker.
name: Simple Rest Faker
title: Simple Rest Faker

api_list.name: generateFakeList
api_list.description: Generating a list with simple fake objects. As key you can pass the property of the object and the value is the faking function from the java faker library. The size in the url is the amount of generated objects.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/fake-data/list/3"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/fake-data/list/{size}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: generateFakeObject
api_list.description: Generating a simple fake object.  As key you can pass the property of the object and the value is the faking function from the java faker library
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/fake-data/object"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-rest-faker.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
